I was in the middle of a debugging session. In Preferences > PHP > Debug > Installed Debuggers > xdebug > Configure, I un-checked "Show super-globals". Then I clicked "Step Over" in the Debug window, and I got a null-pointer exception:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2007-09-11 13:19:32.812
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Execute Debug Command".
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.php.internal.debug.core.xdebug.dbgp.model.DBGpTarget.stepOver(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.php.internal.debug.core.xdebug.dbgp.model.DBGpThread.stepOver(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.php.internal.debug.core.xdebug.dbgp.model.DBGpStackFrame.stepOver(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.commands.StepOverCommand.step(StepOverCommand.java:26)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.commands.StepCommand.doExecute(StepCommand.java:33)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.commands.DebugCommand$1.run(DebugCommand.java:84)

it looks like the session was unexpectedly terminated. Can you recreate this problem as I have tried myself and have not been able to do so. If you can maybe an xdebug log would be helpful. To create one add the following to php.ini
xdebug.remote_log=(path to file)

Thanks
